verses.verse: Serving All Men For though I am (1 Cor. 9:1) free from all men, (2 Cor. 4:5; Gal. 5:13) I have made myself a servant to all, (Matt. 18:15; 1 Pet. 3:1) that I might win the more;
and (Acts 16:3; 21:23-26; Rom. 11:14) to the Jews I became as a Jew, that I might win Jews; to those who are under the law, as under the law, that I might win those who are under the law;

((Gal. 2:3; 3:2)) to ((Rom. 2:12, 14)) those who are without law, as without law ((1 Cor. 7:22; Gal. 6:2)) (not being without law toward God, but under law toward Christ), that I might win those who are without law;
(Rom. 14:1; 15:1; 2 Cor. 11:29) to the weak I became as weak, that I might win the weak. (1 Cor. 10:33) I have become all things to all men, (Rom. 11:14) that I might by all means save some.
Now this I do for the gospel’s sake, that I may be partaker of it with you.
Striving for a Crown Do you not know that those who run in a race all run, but one receives the prize? (Gal. 2:2; 2 Tim. 4:7; Heb. 12:1) Run in such a way that you may obtain it.

And everyone who competes for the prize is temperate in all things. Now they do it to obtain a perishable crown, but we for (2 Tim. 4:8; James 1:12; (1 Pet. 5:4; Rev. 2:10; 3:11)) an imperishable crown.
Therefore I run thus: (2 Tim. 2:5) not with uncertainty. Thus I fight: not as one who beats the air.
((Rom. 8:13)) But I discipline my body and ((Rom. 6:18)) bring it into subjection, lest, when I have preached to others, I myself should become (Jer. 6:30; 2 Cor. 13:5) disqualified.

Old Testament Examples Moreover, brethren, I do not want you to be unaware that all our fathers were under (Ex. 13:21, 22; Ps. 105:39) the cloud, all passed through (Ex. 14:21, 22, 29; Neh. 9:11; Ps. 66:6) the sea,
all were baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea,
all ate the same (Ex. 16:4, 15, 35; Deut. 8:3; Neh. 9:15, 20; Ps. 78:24; John 6:31) spiritual food,
and all drank the same (Ex. 17:5-7; Num. 20:11; Ps. 78:15) spiritual drink. For they drank of that spiritual Rock that followed them, and that Rock was Christ.
But with most of them God was not well pleased, for their bodies (Num. 14:29, 37; 26:65; Heb. 3:17; Jude 5) were scattered in the wilderness.
Now these things became our examples, to the intent that we should not lust after evil things as (Num. 11:4, 34; Ps. 106:14) they also lusted.
(Ex. 32:4; 1 Cor. 5:11; 10:14) And do not become idolaters as were some of them. As it is written, (Ex. 32:6; 1 Cor. 15:32) “The people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play.”
(Rev. 2:14) Nor let us commit sexual immorality, as (Num. 25:1-9) some of them did, and (Ps. 106:29) in one day twenty-three thousand fell;
nor let us tempt Christ, as (Ex. 17:2, 7) some of them also tempted, and (Num. 21:6-9) were destroyed by serpents;
nor complain, as (Ex. 16:2) some of them also complained, and (Num. 14:37) were destroyed by (Ex. 12:23; 2 Sam. 24:16; 1 Chr. 21:15; Heb. 11:28) the destroyer.
Now all these things happened to them as examples, and (Rom. 15:4) they were written for our admonition, (Phil. 4:5) upon whom the ends of the ages have come.
Therefore (Rom. 11:20) let him who thinks he stands take heed lest he fall.

No temptation has overtaken you except such as is common to man; but (1 Cor. 1:9) God is faithful, (Ps. 125:3) who will not allow you to be tempted beyond what you are able, but with the temptation will also make the way of escape, that you may be able to bear it.
Flee from Idolatry Therefore, my beloved, (2 Cor. 6:17) flee from idolatry.
I speak as to (1 Cor. 8:1) wise men; judge for yourselves what I say.

(Matt. 26:26-28; Mark 14:23; Luke 22:20; 1 Cor. 11:25) The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of Christ? (Matt. 26:26; Luke 22:19; Acts 2:42; 1 Cor. 11:23) The bread which we break, is it not the communion of the body of Christ?
For (Rom. 12:5; 1 Cor. 12:12, 27; Eph. 4:4, 16; Col. 3:15) we, though many, are one bread and one body; for we all partake of that one bread.
Observe (Rom. 4:12) Israel (Rom. 4:1) after the flesh: (Lev. 3:3; 7:6, 14; Deut. 12:17) Are not those who eat of the sacrifices partakers of the altar?
What am I saying then? (1 Cor. 8:4) That an idol is anything, or what is offered to idols is anything?

Rather, that the things which the Gentiles (Lev. 17:7) sacrifice (Deut. 32:17; Ps. 106:37; Gal. 4:8; Rev. 9:20) they sacrifice to demons and not to God, and I do not want you to have fellowship with demons.
(2 Cor. 6:15, 16) You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and (Deut. 32:38) the cup of demons; you cannot partake of the ((1 Cor. 11:23-29)) Lord’s table and of the table of demons.
Or do we (Deut. 32:21) provoke the Lord to jealousy? (Ezek. 22:14) Are we stronger than He?
All to the Glory of God All things are lawful for me, but not all things are (1 Cor. 6:12) helpful; all things are lawful for me, but not all things edify.
Let no one seek his own, but each one (Phil. 2:4) the other’s well-being.
